main event: On 15th March 1950, a commercial airline pilot reported an unidentified disc-shaped object over Bradford, Illinois, while en route from Chicago to Keokuk, Iowa. The object was observed for approximately 5 minutes at an estimated altitude of 12,000 feet, traveling at about 200 mph in a southeast direction.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by a commercial airline pilot to the 4602d Air Intelligence Service Center through a radio station in Burlington, Iowa.
The object was described as disc-shaped and estimated to be traveling at a speed of 200 mph at an altitude of about 12,000 feet.
No photographs or physical evidence of the object were received by the Wright-Patterson Flight Service Center.
The weather at Bradford, Illinois, on the day of the sighting was estimated to have broken clouds at 25,000 feet.
The conclusion of the report suggested that the object could possibly be an aircraft, as no data indicated otherwise.
result: Possible A/C. No data presented to indicate that an A/C could NOT be the cause. Speed, flight path, etc in accord with this evaluation.
